Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery wine-jar, interior grooved and exterior covered with a light-brown slip, with remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text on the exterior specifying the contents as year 11 wine, and naming the head vintner as Kha-[...].
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (389888) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/389888)
